main event: A pilot and a passenger on a C-47 aircraft sighted a blue-white flame about 60 to 75 feet long while flying 85 miles N.W. of Jacksonville, Florida, mistaking it for a falling star.
interesting points: The flame was observed for about 15-20 seconds as it approached the aircraft.
The passenger saw the flame approach the aircraft but did not see any object from which it could have been ejected.
The pilot pulled the aircraft sharply up to avoid the flame, and when they looked back, it had disappeared.
No significant findings were noted by the co-pilot or engineer on board.
The sighting occurred under 'C A V U' weather conditions with a visibility of 15 miles.
sighted object: blue-white flame about 60 to 75 feet long
witnesses: 1st Lt. J. K. Hahn and T/Sgt. L. H. Young
